Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    This program is used to create a player's hand of Yahtzee. Uses the Die class CPSC 224-01, Spring 2020 Homework #4 Sources to cite: Gaddis chapter 8 bubble sort
    Version:
    v4.0 03/26/20
    Author:
    Eric Gustin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Die> hand
      hand represents a player's hand of dice
      private int SIZE_OF_HAND
      SIZE_OF_HAND represents the number of dice in a player's hand

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand(int size_of_hand, int num_of_sides)
      Hand is the constructor for the Hand class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean fullHouseFound()
      fullHouseFound determines whether a full house exists and returns true if so.
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<Die> getHand()
      getHand is a getter function for the player's hand
      int getSizeOfHand()
      getSizeOfHand is a getter function for the SIZE_OF_HAND int variable
      int maxOfAKindFound()
      maxOfAKindFound calculates and returns the count of the Die value occurring most in the hand but not the value itself
      int maxStraightFound()
      maxStraightFound calculates and returns the length of the longest straight found in a hand
      void outputHand()
      outputHand displays the sideUp for each Die in a hand for the user to see
      void sortHand()
      sort hand sorts the hand so that straights can be evaluated by using the bubble sort from Gaddis chapter 8 translated into Java
      int totalAllDice()
      totalAllDice calculates and returns the total value of all dice in a hand

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public hw4.Hand(int size_of_hand,
            int num_of_sides)
        Hand is the constructor for the Hand class. Initializes SIZE_OF_HAND and hand
        Parameters:
        size_of_hand - the number of dice in a player's hand
        num_of_sides - the number of sides per die which is used to fill the hand with dice that follow this configuration

    • Method Detail

      • getSizeOfHand

        public int getSizeOfHand()
        getSizeOfHand is a getter function for the SIZE_OF_HAND int variable
        Returns:
        SIZE_OF_HAND the number of dice in a player's hand

        java.util.ArrayList<Die> getHand()
        getHand is a getter function for the player's hand
        Returns:
        hand, the player's hand of dice

      • outputHand

        public void outputHand()
        outputHand displays the sideUp for each Die in a hand for the user to see

      • maxOfAKindFound

        public int maxOfAKindFound()
        maxOfAKindFound calculates and returns the count of the Die value occurring most in the hand but not the value itself
        Returns:
        maxCount the largest of-a-kind found in the player's hand

      • totalAllDice

        public int totalAllDice()
        totalAllDice calculates and returns the total value of all dice in a hand
        Returns:
        total the summed value of all the dice in a player's hand

      • sortHand

        public void sortHand()
        sort hand sorts the hand so that straights can be evaluated by using the bubble sort from Gaddis chapter 8 translated into Java

      • maxStraightFound

        public int maxStraightFound()
        maxStraightFound calculates and returns the length of the longest straight found in a hand
        Returns:
        maxLength the longest straight found in the player's hand

      • fullHouseFound

        public boolean fullHouseFound()
        fullHouseFound determines whether a full house exists and returns true if so. Else, returns false. A full house is a 3 of a kind and a 2 of a kind in the same hand. A 5 of a kind is also a full house.
        Returns:
        foundFH a boolean that represents whether or not a player's hand contains a full house
